column13: are scoring guides or criteria used to assess the quality, performance, or effectiveness of a product, service, or process, often used in education, performance reviews, or project evaluations.

column7: Stakeholder analysis
column13: involves identifying, assessing, and prioritizing stakeholders involved in a project or decision-making process to understand their interests, needs, and influence.

column7: History
Age I: Prehistory
column13: the world before ENIAC (1946): Ancient analog computing (Stonehenge, Antikythera mechanism, Salisbury Cathedral clock, etc.), Euclid, Lovelace, Babbage, Gödel, Church, Turing, pre‐electronic (electro‐mechanical and mechanical) hardware

column7: Age II: Early modern (digital) computing
column13: ENIAC, UNIVAC, Bombes (Bletchley Park codebreakers), mainframes, etc.

column7: Age III: Modern (digital) computing
column13: PCs, modern computer hardware, Moore’s Law

column7: Age IV: Internet
column13: networking, internet architecture, browsers and their evolution, standards, big players (Google, Amazon, Microsoft, etc.), distributed computing

column7: Age V: Cloud
column13: smart phones (Apple, Android, and minor ones), cloud computing, remote servers, software as a service (SaaS), security and privacy, social media

column7: Age VI: Emerging AI
column13: assisted technologies including decision making systems, recommendation systems, generative AI and other machine learning driven tools and technologies
